intro: Anisophyllum meyenianum, commonly known as the desert parsley, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Anisophyllum meyenianum is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil in harsh environments.
